name: Pelham Bay Park
address: Middletown Road & Stadium, Avenue, Bronx, NY 10465, USA

reviews.text: Good fun at location
Good experience
Very beautiful
Shadeballs everywhere, saw a bicyclist go about 50mph in the park sign breaking it into pieces with his face. I think he broke every bone in his face when he hit it.
Last 80 degree day @ Orchard Beach, Oct 7, 2026.
Bus Rodeo 2025
Beautiful
I come here to spend time with God like the God of ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± itâ€™s beautiful here ! I do recommend itâ€¦
KAZIMIROFF NATURE TRAIL perfect to enjoy the nature, walking or cycling.
Nice park clean and not too many people.
great place for relaxing stroll, cook out, or fun with the kids
Great park for fishing, camping & hiking
fun course! lots of wildlife. LOL.
Pelham Bay Park is NYCâ€™s largest park, offering vast green spaces, hiking trails, and waterfront views. Itâ€™s perfect for outdoor adventures, picnics, and escaping the city's hustle and bustle.

Pelham Bay Park is a true gem in New York City. It's the perfect place to escape the urban hustle and enjoy nature. I've been here a few times and I always find something new to love.

The park is huge, with beautiful trails for walking and a large waterfront area where you can simply relax and enjoy the view. I highly recommend it for anyone looking to unwind, get some fresh air, and spend time outdoors.

Had a picnic at Pelham Bay Park with my wife and it was such a vibe. We brought food a speaker and Uno cards spent hours just laughing eating and relaxing. Took a nice stroll after definitely one of the best days ever. Highly recommend for a chill day out.

Pelham Bay Park is a beautiful and peaceful place to relax, walk, or spend time with family. ğŸŒ³âœ¨ Itâ€™s spacious, clean, and has plenty of trails and areas to explore. The playgrounds are nice for kids, and itâ€™s very dog-friendly, so itâ€™s perfect if you want to bring your pup along. ğŸ•

Itâ€™s a great spot to enjoy nature right in the city â€” whether youâ€™re going for a picnic, exercise, or just some fresh air. Highly recommend visiting!
Fantastico e pacifico
Nice
itâ€™s an nice area to do bbqs , they have benches and tables.
Greenery and fresh air, just lovely to sit in nature.
I love to take my dog there every other weekend
Muy bonito

A Perfect Family Day at Pelham Bay Park!

We had such a beautiful day at Pelham Bay Park with the whole family! Itâ€™s truly a hidden gem in New York City â€” peaceful, spacious, and full of natural beauty. From wide open green spaces to scenic walking trails and picnic spots, the park offered something for everyone.

The kids had a blast running around, and we enjoyed a relaxing stroll while soaking in the fresh air and calm atmosphere. It was the perfect place to unwind and spend quality time together.

Whether youâ€™re planning a quiet afternoon, a family picnic, or just want to escape the city noise for a while, Pelham Bay Park is a fantastic choice. Canâ€™t wait to come back!

Orchard Beach parking lot is a good starting point for Hunter Island and Two Trees Island trails (they were actual islands before Robert Mosesâ€™ transformation have created Orchard Beach). These are most picturesque and well-maintained ones,â€¦

A huge park, probably the biggest in the city. Everything from two golf courses, driving range,beach, hiking trails, horseback riding, and across a small bridge to the seafood restaurants of City Island.
Es un hermoso parque para compartir con Familia, amigos e incluso si desean estar solos super maravilloso muy organizado todo y llegan personas muy amables que comparten un plato de comida.

The best destination for seafood and fun in the sun without boardwalks and vendors and rides and noise. Lots of parking, police everywhere.  No swim zones are constantly patrolled by the authorities.  Perfect for summer fun!!!

If you thought Central Park was big, you need to come to this park immediately. With a large track and field area that puts Soundview Park's to shame, easy accessibility from the 6 train, free parking, a bunch of pathways to walk along and enjoy the sights (especially now that it's Autumn), a few nice statues to look at, a big playground, a number of different sports courts, and a bunch of areas to sit down and have a barbecue with your family and friends. Great views of the water and city skyline as well, especially a bit closer to nighttime. You can't even see all of the park in one day unless you wanna challenge yourself. Not only that, I felt very safe during my walk through the park, and others that I've encountered have been quite friendly. 10/10 park and highly recommend it.

I love this park. I have one closer to me but itâ€™s so congested with the influx of illegal immigrants in the area I canâ€™t enjoy it anymore. But coming to this park is refreshing to walk around without crowds of people and volleyball netsâ€¦

WunderschÃ¶ne, naturbelassene Waldwege entlang felsiger KÃ¼stenabschnitte des Long Island Sound, einem Meeresarm des Nordwestatlantiks an der OstkÃ¼ste von Nordamerika. In der Region befindet sich auch ein weitlÃ¤ufiger gelber Sandstrand mit einer Uferpromenade an der es neben Sportanlagen auch SÃ¼ÃŸwasser Duschen gibt.
Lugar muy tranquilo donde pasear , tiene su propia playa y una zona donde se puede comer y hacer tu asado .  Muy recomendable para conectar con la naturaleza y relajarse .

I went to visit the beach, it was a very calm day, I had years I didnâ€™t visit, but today I loved everything of it, the kids park very clean and nice. It was very safe, a lot of life guards even though it was a slow day. We had so much fun.

The park has a playground with the biggest jungle gym/playset I have ever seen. Lots of places to stay in the shade, clean grounds, and a great place to spend the day. Two things that should be updated...1. the bathrooms. Right now the door is open and there's a stall right there almost at the door, 2. there are zero food vendors. The only thing there is an ice cream truck who charges $12 for a milk shake. Bring your own lunch.

Great park to go for a nature walk, it has so much to offer for everyone. They have two playgrounds, one for smaller kids and another for ages 4 and up. Lots of picnic and bbq areas. There is also a small water area past the dog park in theâ€¦

Wow!  Where has this very large public park been hidden for so long?!  In plain site and so easy to get to and park, an outdoor day of hiking and beaches and relaxing. Many Bar B Queing going on and a nice and relaxing place to visit. And enjoy a very different view of Long Island and the Bronx. Put it on your list!!

One of the biggest park in the city of New York lots of tree and still very green, the only thing most people donâ€™t dispose their garbage properly. Workers always tried to do there job properly, thanks to that.

Very nice, low key park. The main problem with this park is there is a NYPD shooting range across the bay. This means it is never peaceful. As you try for a nice peaceful walk, it will be inundated with sounds of automatic weapons andâ€¦

MY FAVORITE LOCAL PARK. I almost got robbed though I was walking through a sketchy area cause I thought it was safe until I saw and heard a man with a ski mask walking closer behind me I felt a primal fear and I called my boyfriend thankâ€¦
Nice outdoor space for walk in nature close to NYC. Short and easy.

I want this place to beginning of. August is nice and peaceful is considered to be one of the only places left in the Bronx that is not so rowdy and dirty. Iâ€™ll give it a four star. It seems like itâ€™s family friendly.

Huge park, was a lot of fun to bike ride.  Expect a tonne of cars with radios blasting in the parking lot.  The sandy beaches are very nice, and some great hiking trails.  My wife and I took mountain bikes on the trails as well and enjoyed the off roading.  I believe the park officially opens next weekend and will charge a fee.

I attended a cookout, lots of fun. Park was very clean, great for events and cookouts. Its unfortunate that nice parks have subcome to people using violence. I had been to Pelham park in almost 20 years, but still nice and clean

Took my daughter to horseback riding. Sheâ€™s five. The entire experience from beginning to end was the best. I am a single mother on a budget. Trying to find something I only can do with my daughter as she gets bigger. I would recommend thisâ€¦
Pelham Bay Park is a very underrated park! Definitely recommend taking the 6 up to the last stop to enjoy the views. Not an urban park, but feels like actual nature. Bring water and sunscreen.
Very good place to enjoy water sides and nature.

Pelham Bay Park is a beautiful place to go with your Family and friends you can take your lunch or grill your hamburgers, this view is amazing, the sunset ğŸŒ… is beautiful, plenty parking and restrooms available. Really enjoy this beautifulâ€¦

u will find numbers of dogs here roaming. this is the largest park of the city. some old forest also avilable here. the natural scenery of this park is very beautiful. the walkways are also very favourable for all.â€¦

This place has been a perfect atmosphere for me and my family for the past 15 years I love this park it has historical places and statues itâ€™s historic itâ€™s self and it has everything you need to have a good time from orchard beach to fishing bike riding soft ball mini golf course boating docks gun range and many more .

Come one come all to Pelham bay park .
I enjoyed Pelham Bay Park.  I went on the trails on Hunter Island and visited Glovers Rock.  The trails were interesting and scenic.  The park was quiet and peaceful during this time of year.

Not only does it have two parks for the kids to play, with swings and slides, and a doggie park, and BBQ area, but there's this beautiful view in the back area. Great for fishing or a hike or a picnic with a view. Wait for dry weather or you'll mess up your footwear with mud.

2023-01-28 was here for a ranger led seal watch. I love the Park Rangers. Used one of at least two incredibly spacious bathrooms. I was able to walk my bike in. A good thing because there is no bike parking. Needs a citibike dock.

My reviews tend to be bike oriented.  I don't own a car but will rent one on vacations. If this perspective interests you, then you may want to follow my reviews.  Google Maps does not have a keyword for bike or biking.  Why is that?

4 yrs ago. Was only in a small part but still impressed

NYC's biggest park, so lots of ground to cover. During this review mostly the shoreline was shirted, and some hiking trails explored. In fair weather it makes for a nice experience, and locals have a standing agreement not to shank you, which is generous.

First off I went to orchard to Orchard beach in a cold November and the view was absolutely amazing. I donâ€™t know about the beach during the summer time but if you would like to have some alone time with your partner this would be the place.

My favorite place to disconnect from city life. Feels like another world if you find the right hiking path. Water views, gorgeous trails, beautifully kept areas for family, tennis courts, track and bocce ball courts too (I don't even know what bocce is but I'll find out).

It's a huge park. I love the quiet. There is a dog park, and a small beach area which was cleaned up. There is a large playground, and a smaller one for younger kids. There are also restrooms. There are several baseball fields, tennis courts, and a beautiful track.

Nice ParkğŸ to go with families, friends and not mentioning you can celebrate Birthdays, Wedding, Babyshower, Graduation ceremony, BBQ, or just to enjoy everything ğŸ˜€but the only issue is some people doesn't clean up after themselves and that isn't good if we want to keep it clean. Please let's do our best to keep our Park clean ğŸ˜‰â€¦
